titles: A pleasant conceited comedie, wherein is shewed, how a man may chuse a good wife from a bad As it hath bene sundry times acted by the Earle of Worcesters seruants.
How a man may chuse a good wife from a bad
author: Heywood, Thomas, d. 1641.
Cooke, Jo., fl. 1614, attributed name.
publisher: Printed [by T. Creede] for Mathew Lawe, and are to be solde at his shop in Paules Church-yard, neere vnto S. Augustines gate, at the signe of the Foxe,
notes: Attributed to Thomas Heywood. Sometimes also attributed to "Joshua Cooke" (i.e. John Cooke?).
Reproduction of the original in the Eton College. Library.
